Arrow right #1 Icon Created with Sketch.               “Two flyovers at these two corridor have been proposed along with U-turns and closing of the cuts,” said the official, adding that a meeting of stakeholders like the Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation (GMC), the Public Works Department (PWD) and others will be convened to discuss the implementation. For the Hapur road stretch, a flyover has been planned near Hapur Chungi which will connect the road from Shastri Nagar to Raj Nagar Extension. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“A 300-metre-long flyover at Hapur Chungi will enable seamless traffic movement from Shastri Nagar to Raj Nagar Extension,” said Singh. “Along the Hapur road stretch, a U-turn near Govindpuram has been suggested. In addition to this, a cut will be opened near the collectorate while another cut on Raj Nagar curve will be closed,” added Singh. The entire stretch will be fenced on the median. No pedestrian movement will be allowed. The chief engineer said that by the end of the year, Choudhary Mor will become an intersection. “The Dhobhi Ghat rail overbridge (ROB) from Vijay Nagar side of Ghaziabad railway station will be completed and descend here. So, CRRI has proposed widening of the side lanes for vehicles,” he added. The Authority officials have stressed on the need for a new flyover, about 800 metres, over GT Road which will take vehicles towards NH-9 and bypass the Choudhary Mor intersection. Apart from the two corridors, the CRRI has also suggested changes in the design of roads on 14 junctions, including the GDA Old Bus Adda, Choudhary Mor, Gukhna, Madhuban Bapudham, Raj Nagar Extension, Maliwara Chowk, Hindon Airport Domestic Terminal Chowk and Kanawni, said the official. The CRRI report mentions that these intersections are poorly designed and allow on-street parking and stopping and standing at the corners, and the problem gets compounded by wrong-lane driving and encroachments.  Noida to review new U-turn designs Noida: Noida Authority CEO Ritu Maheshwari has asked officials to get the designs of upcoming U-turns checked by the Central Road Research Institute (CRRI) to review if there can be cost savings without requiring widening of the central verge for creating U-turns. The CEO reviewed several pending projects and infrastructure work in Sectors 72, 115, 117, 119 and Bisrakh Road and directed authorities to take necessary action. The condition of footpaths and central verge was found unsatisfactory and officials have been instructed to paint the central verge and remove obstruction and wild vegetation that has covered footpaths at several places. “Signage is not available at several places and needs to be placed for convenience of residents. The design of U-turns will be reviewed for better traffic management. Also, many projects are pending as the entire land required has not been acquired by the authority. I have asked all such land procurement to be completed before beginning anything new,” said Maheshwari. Latest CommentGppd news for residents of Ghaziabad and NOIDA. Hope the projects see light of day soon.Sandeep SharmaSee All CommentsAdd commentFinishing of Bisrakh Road and Master Green Park in Sector 117 has been pending due to incomplete land acquisition. The CEO has asked that work on Master Green Park be stopped and reviewed by a committee headed by general manager KK Aggarwal. Officials said the park was supposed to be developed across 55 acres. But about 40% of the requisite land (22 acres) has been acquired so far. The committee will review the situation and submit a report on whether additional land should be acquired or the plan should be modified according to resources needed.

column2: Court orders FIR against MLA for cheating
column3: GHAZIABAD: A local court has ordered that an FIR be filed against the BSP MLA from Dhaulana, Aslam Chaudhary, his two sons and a few others in a cheating and forgery case. Yamin Chaudhary (61), a doctor from Masuri, has alleged that the MLA was trying to grab his land on the basis of forged receipts. The MLA, on the other hand, has termed the complaint a political conspiracy and claimed that a criminal case had been filed against the doctor earlier this month on similar charges. The court order was passed on July 20. The doctor’s counsel, Subodh Kumar Tyagi, said: “The accused persons forged receipts and said they had paid money to my client and bought his land. My client has stated that the accused never had visited his home. So, there was no question of selling the plot to them.” NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Tyagi said that earlier this month, an FIR was registered against the doctor and his four children by some people. They alleged that Yamin took money from them but was not registering the land in their names. “We informed the court about the forgery and urged it to order a forensic test of signatures on those receipts,” Tyagi alleged. The MLA refuted all allegations. “My son and several others have bought plots on the said land. But Yamin is not registering the plot in their names. When no resolution was found, they lodged a complaint against Yamin following the court’s order. Now, Yamin is trying to implicate me.”

column2: GMC panel indicts 26 dairy owners for 15-year-old’s death
column3: GHAZIABAD: A three-member committee formed by Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation to probe into the drowning of a 15-year-old boy in a drain in Vijay Nagar last week has indicted 26 local dairy owners for encroaching upon the nullah and dumping manure and other waste in it. The civic body has now asked police to act against the offenders. Deepanshu Pal, a resident of Shivpuri, was cycling through a waterlogged road in Sarvodaya Nagar last Saturday (July 20) when he fell into the drain through a gaping 8 by 8 feet hole left by GMC that had repaired the stretch two weeks ago. The Class X student’s body was fished out after three hours of search, 200 metres from the spot where he drowned. Officials said the GMC has now written a letter to the local police to initiate action against the dairy owners for violating directives of the National Green Tribunal by dumping waste in the drain. Moreover, zonal officers have been directed to impose a penalty of Rs 50,000 on each of the offenders under the UP plastic and garbage (regulation) act. As a part of the probe, the committee, headed by GMC additional commissioner Shivpujan Yadav, had recorded statements of local residents, who blamed dairy owners for encroaching upon the drain. Notably, it did not find any negligence on the part of GMC even though residents blamed the agency for not placing a signboard near the hole. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Moreover, the committee said in its report that a letter through the Ghaziabad district magistrate’s office will be soon sent to the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) for conducting a technical inspection on the stretch and levelling the drains being built by them on the sides of the highway to with those in Vijay Nagar. GMC commissioner Dinesh Chandra has also formed a separate three-member committee to prepare a plan to deal with the waterlogging problem in Vijay Nagar.

column2: Stink, pipe leaks greet freshers at LU hostels
column3: LUCKNOW: It's been a week since the new academic session of Lucknow University began but most of the boys' hostels are still not ready for newcomers. A reality check done by TOI found three of the five boys' hostels in pitiable conditions. These are Mahmudabad, Habibullah and Acharya Narendra Dev hostels. What awaits freshers are hanging wires, garbage piles, and broken doors and windows. Plaster is peeling off the walls, rooms are damp, washrooms are without latches and water pipelines have leakages. Freshers are unwilling to move in under such conditions. "I have submitted the hostel fee but after seeing the condition of hostels I don't want to avail the facility," said BA student Ankit Singh. Students who have availed the hostel facility are looking for other options. "There is a garbage dump right behind the hostels which is a breeding ground for insects and mosquitoes. I'm contemplating shifting to a rented room near the university," said Abhishek, who has been allotted a room in Mahmudabad hostel. "Last year, two hostellers were injured when plaster fell on them in the rooms," said Prabhat of Habibullah hostel. He also complained of poor drainage in the hostels. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Dean of students welfare Prof Dhruv Sen Singh said, "In July first week, all the provosts were directed to ensure proper maintenance in the hostels. An inventory was made of repair work and infrastructure required in hostels. Work has been done in some hostels and it would be completed shortly in the remaining hostels."

column2: Lucknow: Advocate arrested for rape bid on niece
column3: LUCKNOW: A high court advocate was arrested on Friday after his 21-year-old niece lodged an FIR at Madiaon, saying he had tried to rape her at their joint family residence. The 48-year-old accused has been book for attempted rape, voluntarily causing hurt and use of foul language. According to what the woman told police, she lost her father on June 17 and ever since, her uncle has been targeting her. His purpose, she said, is to ensure that her family, including her mother and younger sister, left their ancestral house. "Around 11am, he (Srivastava) knocked on our door. Since my mother and sister were out, I told him to come back later. But, he came in anyway, saying he needed some grocery items. He locked the main door behind him and tried to force himself upon me," the survivor said in her complaint. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Madiaon SHO Santosh Kumar Singh said they had arrested Srivastava. "The woman has claimed that he had tried to rape her earlier too."

column2: Three days on, cops clueless on techie's murder
column3: LUCKNOW: Even after questioning more than 30 close friends and relatives, the police are yet to find any substantial lead in the murder of software engineer Sharad Nigam who was shot dead in Thakurganj area on Tuesday night. According to police, nobody is able to answer where he spent over one-and-a-half hour which could provide a clue to the crime. "Not many people, including his parents and friends, knew much about his personal life. He was an introvert which makes the case more difficult as we have little information about his lifestyle," SHO, Thakurganj, Neeraj Ojha said.

column2: Sitapur: Coaching institute teacher rapes girl
column3: LUCKNOW: A teacher at a coaching institute in Sitapur was arrested on Friday for allegedly raping a 19-year-old girl and making the video of the act viral, police said. The rape survivor was preparing for competitive examinations and came in contact with the accused, Uday Raj (25), a few months ago. The rape survivor’s brother lodged an FIR after an obscene video of his sister was circulated by the accused. “The girl used to visit the teacher to take mathematics lessons. After the classes, Raj used to force himself upon her and also filmed the act. The victim was afraid of narrating the ordeal to anybody as Raj threatened her that he would circulate her video,” said SHO, Kotwali, Amber Singh. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“On Wednesday, Raj again tried to harass the girl but she managed to escape. She narrated the ordeal to her parents,” Singh added. In the meantime, Raj forwarded the video to some of his acquaintances. Next day, the girl’s kin came to know about the video and lodged a case against Raj accusing him of rape and causing hurt. Singh said the medical examination report of the girl was awaited while preliminary investigation revealed that Raj wanted to marry the girl but she resisted his overtures. “It also came to light that Raj was a post-graduate in commerce and got a job in the Indian Army,” the SHO said.

column2: Three shoot at, rob jeweller in Sitapur
column3: LUCKNOW: Three masked men on a bike shot at and injured a jeweller before decamping with cash and jewellery worth Rs 12 lakh in Sitapur on Friday. Kamal Kishorewas going to his shop with his nephew on a two-wheeler when they were intercepted. “All of them had their faces covered and had pistols. I tried to flee on foot, but couldn’t,” he said. column2: Yogi Adityanath bats for technologies useful to common man
column3: LUCKNOW: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath said universities like Dr APJ Kalam Technical University (AKTU) should work on technologies which are economical and useful for the common man as they will help in bringing about a positive change in their lives. The CM was speaking during AKTU's Foundation Day celebrations on Friday. Citing the example of Kumbh Mela organised in Allahabad earlier this year, he said technology could be used in efficient management of big events.  "The use of technology in daily life brings about happiness and comfort. It was because of the effective use of technology, that we were able organise the Kumbh Mela in such a short span of time," the CM added.

column2: Jail term, Rs 5 lakh fine for illegal boring: UP Groundwater law
column3: LUCKNOW: Anybody guilty of unregulated and illegal drilling of borewells will be jailed for a year and fined Rs 5 lakh, according to UP Groundwater (management and regulation) Act, 2019, which was passed by voice vote in the Assembly on Friday. The bill, which was tabled in UP assembly by minor irrigation and ground water minister Dharam Pal Singh, states those violating provisions for the second time would be slapped a double fine and the jail term may be extended to three years. The bill was also passed by the UP legislative council . The bill applies to individuals, commercial and industrial establishments and says indiscriminate exploitation has depleted groundwater in several areas of the state. The bill mentions any commercial establishment will have to register with the Ground Water Authority and withdrawals will be limited as per rules framed by the state ground water department. Violating rules will invite punishment that includes fine and a prison term. The bill also mentions that the user should ensure ground water is not polluted, even during boring. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.In some areas, source of ground water table has dried up. The bill says conservation is important as ground water is linked to livelihood of people and development of the state. Latest Commentthose who have been using submersible pump  should be asked to put a water meter which government should check if they are pumping water more than the limit fixed by the government or all borewell sh...Read MoreSyedqamarSee All CommentsAdd commentThe state government needs to take steps to ensure rise in groundwater table, besides maintaining quality. Also, the bill states regulation could help face challenges linked to environmental factors. It also makes a reference to a Supreme Court ruling that says individual right on ground water is not appropriate since it can lead to a dangerous fall in groundwater table. The bill says withdrawal of ground water in a regulated way is necessary in larger public interest and should top government priority. It categorically mentions ground water be used for drinking, domestic and animal use.

column2: UP: 1.4 lakh cases of power theft in 2018, says Srikant Sharma
column3: LUCKNOW: More than 1.4 lakh cases of power pilferage were reported in the state in 2018-19 financial, energy minister Srikant Sharma informed the Assembly on the last day of monsoon session on Friday. This means that, on an average, over 400 cases of power pilferage per day were reported in the last financial. Replying to a question raised by BJP MLA Harvardhan Bajpai in the Assembly, Srikant Sharma said the enforcement squad of UP Power Corporation Limited conducted raids on more than 2.3 lakh houses and commercial establishments and detected over 1.4 lakh instances of power pilferages during the said period. These numbers were besides over 32,500 cases of discrepancies in consumption of electricity by consumers. Sharma said that FIRs were being lodged and other legal actions were being initiated against the consumers found involved in power pilferage. The government admission in the assembly comes amid UP grappling with about 30% power line losses, mainly due to electricity pilferage. Sharma said the government has approved setting up of a police station in every district that would take up cases of power theft. He said the government has also approved 55 new enforcement squads that would crack down on consumers found engaged in power pilferage. This is in addition to existing 33 enforcement squads of UPPCL. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The minister said that the electricity divisions in urban areas which record high rate of power pilferage have been allocated Rs 1 crore each to convert the existing distribution lines into aerial bunch conductors (ABC). Under the project, he said, the government has given its nod to converting 1,000 km of distribution lines into ABC cables.

column2: Private University Bill sails through Vidhan Parishad
column3: LUCKNOW: The Private University Bill that was passed by the Assembly on Thursday by voice vote also sailed through Vidhan Parishad (Upper House) despite the fact that the BJP is in minority there. Even though Samajwadi Party, in majority in the Upper House, had initially said that it would refer the bill to a committee, the members only proposed one amendment which too was rejected by the chairperson. The bill bans anti-national activity on campuses and a violation will invite legal action. The government had earlier brought in an ordinance through the cabinet, which made it mandatory for universities to give an undertaking they would not allow any anti-national activity on campus. The bill will cover 27 private universities in the state and aims to bring uniformity in terms of academic calendar, fee structure among others. Under the bill, caste or religion cannot be a ground for admission though a university will be required to ensure quota for SC/ST, OBC and economically backward students and employees as per the state government directives. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.On Friday, the last day of the monsoon session, the Vidhan Parishad passed four more bills. However, they were not cleared without controversy. Shortly after the UP Revenue Code (Amendment) Bill, 2019 and the UP Water Recharge and Sewer Management (Amendment Bill) 2019, were introduced in the House, Opposition members challenged an attempt to have them passed with any discussion. SP MLC Shatrudra Prakash said that it seemed like members were attending the House only as a formality.

column2: Atal Bihari Vajpayee’s ash immersion ritual cost state Rs 2.24 crore
column3: LUCKNOW: Ceremonies to mark the immersion of the ashes of former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee cost Rs 2.24 crore to the state exchequer. The fact came to light in a written reply by CM Yogi Adityanath to a question by Congress MLC Deepak Singh in the Vidhan Parishad on Friday. The ceremony took place in Lucknow on August 23 last year but the payment to different firms is yet to be made. In the reply, the CM said that the expenditure was negotiated with various firms by the Lucknow Development Authority and the state information department would make the full payment to LDA. Latest CommentA clear example of waste of public money.............2.24 crore is too huge........ In a state where general public is forced to carry their sick relatives & even their dead bodies in their arms ...Read MoreHimanshu VermaSee All CommentsAdd commentVajpayee had passed away on August 16, 2018, in Delhi while his ashes were submerged in the Gomti in Lucknow in an elaborate ceremony on August 23. The event was attended by leaders from across political parties. Recently, a controversy had erupted over the department which had to make payments. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.While the information department said it would take care of the dues, the CM’s response made it clear that the payment has not yet been made. The break-up of the expenditure includes Rs 1.56 crore on tents, Rs 8.52 lakh on sound arrangements, Rs 8.26 lakh on floral decorations and Rs 51.48 lakh on lighting.

column2: UP: Government admits to teachers' crunch in schools
column3: LUCKNOW: The issue of acute shortage of teachers in aided, non-government high schools and intermediate colleges came up for discussion in Vidhan Parishad on Friday. Replying to a question on the shortage of teachers in Bulandshahr, education minister and leader of the house Dinesh Sharma said there were four schools in the district where against the sanctioned posts, not a single teacher had been hired. He said in place of permanent staff, teachers from Parent Teachers Associations (PTA) were taking classes. Latest CommentWith reduced allocation of Budget for education in UP, it is not possible to fill up vacancies of teaching staff in state which is contrary to promise made by NAMO during 2014 LS election campaign th...Read MoreSheik MohamedSee All CommentsAdd commentOP Sharma, a senior member of the Shikshak Dal who had raised the issue in the House, contradicted Dinesh Sharma over the appointment of PTA teachers. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy."PTA is not allowed to appoint teachers. Its role is completely different," he said. Sharma said though it was an old practice, the system should be discontinued.

column2: Ayodhya seer dies in road accident
column3: KANPUR/AYODHYA: Chief mahant of prestigious Phatik Shila Temple of Ayodhya mahant Ram Aagya Das (70) died in a road accident in Saurikh area of Kannauj on Friday morning. Das, who was also the chief mahant of Sitaram Mandir in Vrindavan, was travelling to Ayodhya from Vrindavan via Kannauj when his SUV collided with a road divider on Agra-Lucknow Expressway. Nemi Chand, an associate of the mahant, who was driving the vehicle also sustained grievous injuries. Das and his driver were rushed to KGMU Trauma Centre in Lucknow where Das was declared brought dead on arrival while the condition of the driver was stated to be critical, police said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Sukh Dev Das, priest of Phatik Shila Temple, said: "Mahant Ram Aagya Das had opposed the acquisition of land for the installation of Lord Ram's statue. He formally registered his opposition with chief minister Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow last month. He had asked the CM if the government would demolish an existing temple to install the Ram statue.
