column2: Yogi Adityanath wins accolades at business show
column3: LUCKNOW: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath stole the show at the second ground-breaking ceremony confirming an investment of Rs 65,000 crore with over 1,025 projects. And, BJP president and Union Home minister Amit Shah showered praises on him, saying the road to $5 trillion economy will pass through UP. This was for the first time after the good showing by BJP in UP at the Lok Sabha elections that Shah has admitted that anointing Yogi as chief minister has paid dividends. As result of the general election showed, Yogi did not allow anti-incumbency to grip the state which prompted Shah to say that though he was "warned" of Yogi's "inexperience" in administration - not having run even a municipal body - he delivered in his first two years as the CM. Not just Shah, but Governor Ram Naik and industrialists present at the meet, called Yogi an "energetic and dedicated CM." Yogi reciprocated by saying: "Whenever I am in a dilemma on any issue, I call up Amitji to seek his guidance and get things resolved".

column2: Easy land allotment policy to facilitate defence corridor
column3: Lucknow: Timely clearance of land and licences turned out to be a major concern of investors who evinced interest in the UP defence industrial corridor during the second groundbreaking event at IGP on Sunday. The government on its part promised an easy land allotment policy soon. According to CEO of Uttar Pradesh Expressways Industrial Development Authority (UPEIDA) Awanish Awasthi, the corridor will pass through the six districts of Lucknow, Agra, Aligarh, Jhansi, Chitrakoot and Kanpur. More than 5,071 hectares will be acquired. Around 59% of the total land is needed in Jhansi; followed by 20% in Kanpur; 10% in Chitrakoot; 6% in Agra; 4% in Lucknow; 1% in Aligarh. Officials of UPEIDA said final land proposal from Agra and Kanpur were awaited. Since IIT-Kanpur is the technical adviser and partner in the corridor project, it will give a chunk of land.Investors from SMPP Private Ltd, BAE Systems and MKU Private Ltd raised concerns during the 45-minute panel discussion led by director, defence and aerospace, Colonel (retd) KV Kuber. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Managing director of MKU Vaibhav Gupta, MD of BAE Systems Nikhil Khanna and executive director of SMPP Ashish Kansal said land cost, licences and timely land allotment were major concerns before the project could be kicked off. Awasthi assured investors that work to draft a policy for easy allotment of land was underway and it would take another 45 days to be ready. Once the policy is implemented, allotment of land will be easier. Also, discount will be given in cost of land. "We are planning to meet the defence minister to sort out things," state industry minister Satish Mahana said.

column2: Adani to invest in data centres, defence, Rs 5,000 crore in power
column3: LUCKNOW: Adani Group chairman and managing director, Gautam Adani, has expressed interest in developing a defence hub along the upcoming defence corridor in Uttar Pradesh. Giving a fillip to the state governments industrialisation plans, while speaking at the second groundbreaking ceremony on Sunday, Adani also committed Rs 5,000 crore for power sector in the state, in addition to the Rs 5,000 crore for which he had signed MoUs with state government in 2018. "We have also decided to invest in new age fields like data centres and defence. Given UP's size, strategic location and demographic dividend, I think UP can become a leading market in both these sectors with maximum potential for direct, indirect and induced job creations," he said. Adani added that his company has started working on plans to develop a multi-modal river terminal in Varanasi and was investing Rs 500 crore in developing rice, flour and dal mills and 'kachchi ghani' refining facilities in the state, which would be a boost to the agro industry.

column2: Unnao rape survivor has multiple fractures
column3: LUCKNOW: The Unnao rape survivor, who sustained serious injuries after her car met with an accident in Rae Bareli district on Sunday, continued to be in a critical condition at the trauma centre of King George's Medical University (KGMU). Along with the survivor, her lawyer Mahendra Singh, who suffered head injury and multiple fractures in his limbs, was put on ventilator support and his condition was stated to be extremely critical. SkipThe survivor's aunt was declared brought dead. After initial tests and first aid, the rape survivor was found to have suffered fractures and internal injuries and showed little positive response to treatment. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.KGMU spokesman Dr Sudhir Singh said, "Three patients, including two women, were brought to the trauma centre on Sunday. The elder woman was declared brought dead and the other woman (rape survivor) is critical. The injured man was put on ventilator support." Later in the evening, the survivor's mother and her siblings reached trauma centre from their village Maakhi in Unnao.

column2: Restricted routes, U-turns slow down Faizabad Road traffic
column3: LUCKNOW: The barricades put up on routes leading up to Indira Gandhi Pratishthan (IGP) in view of the VIPs visiting Lucknow brought traffic to a grinding halt on Faizabad Road and adjoining areas on Sunday . The light showers also slowed down traffic movement along the stretch. As part of its arrangements for the second groundbreaking ceremony in the city, police had put up barricades on several routes leading up to the event's venue-IGP. As vehicles were not allowed on several routes near IGP, they were forced to take longer alternate routes most of which passed through Faizabad Road. The stretch between Chinhat trisection and Polytechnic Crossing was worst hit by the chaos. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Vibhuti Khand resident Pankaj Verma said, "The road is jammed as many people are taking U-turns because they didn't know about the traffic curbs on routes." The rain slowed down two-wheelers and three-wheelers as several people stopped to take cover under the footover bridge near Polytechnic crossing. Latest CommentHope authorities will look in to the current traffic situation and traffic flow and amend / lift the restrictionsSYED ABDULMUQTADIRSee All CommentsAdd commentVipul Mishra, a businessman who owns a hotel in Gomtinagar, said, "Several commuters parked their vehicles under the overbridge, which has left lesser space for people to drive by. Such haphazard parking is leading to traffic snarls." Traffic police inspector, Jagmohan Singh Bisht, said, "Traffic slowed down as commuters unaware about diversions started taking U-turns."

column2: Girl cries delay in FIR on sexual harassment
column3: LUCKNOW: A victim of sexual harassment case on Sunday accused the Jankipuram police of delaying registration of her case. On July 26, a local youth, identified as Rajesh, barged into a shanty in Jankipuram where a girl was all alone. Rajesh attempted to force himself on the girl but the girl raised an alarm. The residents rushed to her rescue and nabbed the culprit. The residents said they took Rajesh to the police but they did not register a case and let him off claiming that there were no evidence to prove his guilt. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy."On Sunday, the police lodged an FIR when a local politician advocated our case," the victim's father told TOI. Latest CommentWhat kind of police administration is that?SYED ABDULMUQTADIRSee All CommentsAdd commentSHO, Jankipuram, Mohammed Ashraf claimed that a case had been registered and Rajesh would be nabbed soon. Meanwhile, Bazaarkhala police on Sunday arrested a person Zaid aka Talib of Chowk in connection with a rape case that allegedly took place on July 17.

column2: Ram Naik thanks Anandiben Patel for giving extra week as Governor
column3: LUCKNOW: Ram Naik, who will be welcoming new UP Governor Anandiben Patel in Lucknow on Monday, thanked her for giving him the "bonus of an additional week as Governor".  In a light-hearted moment during Sunday's groundbreaking ceremony, Naik said he had to thank Patel for being able to attend the function. "My term as Governor ended on July 22 but because she is arriving on Monday, I got an additional week as Governor," he said. Naik also explained why he broke convention by staying back to welcome Patel since governors usually leave Raj Bhawan by the time their successor comes to take oath. "When I heard of this tradition, I questioned it. When a President takes oath, he or she is welcomed into Rashtrapati Bhawan by the predecessor and then both drive together to Parliament for oath-taking ceremony. I also decided to stay back to welcome the new governor," he said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.

column2: FIR against MLA, 29 others for plot to kill Unnao rape survivor
column3: LUCKNOW: Twenty-four hours after a speeding truck crashed into the car in which the Unnao rape survivor was travelling, UP police booked jailed BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar and 29 of his associates on charges of criminal conspiracy, murder and attempt to murder. Two aunts of the rape survivor died in the accident on Sunday, while the survivor and her lawyer were both critically injured. She was put on ventilator support on Monday. The FIR was lodged at Gurubakshganj police station on a complaint by the survivor's uncle, who's doing time in Rae Bareli prison, following conviction in a case of attempted murder and forgery lodged by Sengar's brother. The survivor was on her way to meet her uncle when the crash occurred. Top CommentWhy Kuldeep singh is still BJP MLA. Why can’t the BJP party suspend him after all these visible crimesCut Off all his support and financial strength.a d power.RaviSee All CommentsAdd commentCBI to investigate Unnao rape survivor's accident caseNEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.In the FIR, besides Sengar, his relative Manoj Singh, Vinod Mishra, Haripal Singh, Naveen Singh, Komal Singh, Arun Singh, Gyanendra Singh, Rinku Singh, and his lawyer Awadesh Singh have been named. Sengar's 20 unidentified aides are also accused.

column2: Kanpur ladies go black & white at this do
column3: Ladies dressed in their fashionable best in black and white, dancing to peppy music and playing several games, these were the ingredients of a salt and pepper themed party, organised by a ladies club in Kanpur, recently. The venue was beautifully decorated with black and white balloons, which perfectly complemented the theme of the party. Amandeep Sethi, one of the organizers, ensured that the members had a blast at the do. Later, a dancing session for the femme-brigade kept them thoroughly entertained. Rashmi Jain, Richa Agnihotri, Neeti Agarwal, Shivika Rastogi and Shruti Tandon were spotted dancing on peppy Bollywood remixes. Towards the end, Shweta Bhadhoo, was awarded the title of Miss Salt & Pepper for her dress. column2: Three versions to this murder mystery in Lucknow!
column3: A play titled 'Kahani Rashomon Ki' was staged at Rai Umanath Bali Auditorium in Qaiserbagh. Through the play, director Manish Saini narrated the story of a murder from the perspective of three different men – a thief, a purohit and a woodcutter. They discussed the murder of a prince at a gate called Rashomon. All three men come up with different versions of the same murder. A scene from the play (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) A scene from the play (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) The play had some very talented theatre artists who acted well. Somnath, a junior artist said, "Kahaani Rashomon Ki had some very good characterization. The artists were well coordinated. It is rare to see such plays in the city where the artists are so cooperative. Right from the lighting, to direction to the sound to characterization, everything was superb. Plays like this should be staged more often." (L) Aaryan Tandon (R) Ahmad Raza Khan (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) (L) Aaryan Tandon (R) Ahmad Raza Khan (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.When asked to talk about the play, director Manish Saini said, "This play is based on an incident where Yuvraaj dies and three different witnesses have different things to say about the murder. This way the real murderer isn’t discovered. Through this play, I want to convey that people only tell what they see or whatever little they want to disclose. There is a very fine line between a truth and a lie." — Yashi Agarwal (L) Akshat and Marc Dixit (R) Gopal Sinha (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) (L) Akshat and Marc Dixit (R) Gopal Sinha (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) (L) Kartik (C) Lalit Singh Pokhriya (R) Mohd Saif (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) (L) Kartik (C) Lalit Singh Pokhriya (R) Mohd Saif (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) (L) Nitish Bhardwaj (C) Sangam Bahuguna (R) Vikrant and Neha Tankha (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) (L) Nitish Bhardwaj (C) Sangam Bahuguna (R) Vikrant and Neha Tankha (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)

column2: Days back, Unnao survivor told cops of threats to life
column3: LUCKNOW: The Unnao rape survivor and her family members, including the aunt who died in Sunday's car crash on NH-31 in Rae Bareli, had informed the police brass about a threat to them from jailed BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar's henchmen. The family claims to have given a written complaint to the Unnao police on July 13 with details of threats and pressure to withdraw the case against Sengar. It may be recalled that in April, the survivor and her family had told TOI they were living in fear, with the girl stationed 600km from her home for safety reasons. She had then told TOI, "I informed CBI that I don't feel safe. I fear for my life, I fear being abducted or killed by Sengar's men the day I step into my village." In the July 13 complaint, the family had identified those issuing threats and attached videos and photographs of two instances of intimidation on July 7 and 8 while demanding that FIR be registered against the culprits. However, Unnao superintendent of police MP Verma denied having received any such complaint. Maakhi police station in charge Narad Muni Singh, too, said, "I am not aware of such a written complaint from the family." The survivor's mother, her elder sister and the aunt - who died in Sunday's car crash - had elaborated about the two threats in their complaint. plaint. At 9am on July 7, Kuldeep's relative Manoj, rape case co-accused Shashi Singh's son Naveen, one Kunnu Mishra and two unidentified persons came to the survivor's house in Maakhi village, according to the complaint. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Sitting inside a car, they threatened the family with dire consequences if they did not withdraw the rape case. On July 8, the complaint said, Shashi's husband Harpal had come to the survivor's house and threatened to "wipe out the entire family by sending them to jail on fake charges". "Photographs and videos of the two incidents were submitted as proof along with the complaint to the Unnao police, senior police officers, the chief minister, Prime Minister, CBI and even Chief Justice of Allahabad high court, through registered post," said Vimal Kumar Yadav, one of the advocates of the family. "We have a 'receiving' with us in Unnao, but no action was taken on the complaint. No FIR was lodged either," he added.

column2: Unnao rape case: CBI filed chargesheets against BJP MLA Sengar last year, but trial yet to start
column3: NEW DELHI: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) had filed chargesheets against BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar in the Unnao rape case last year but the trial is yet to begin. Sengar, MLA from Bangarmau in Unnao, is currently lodged in Sitapur district jail. The survivor, whose condition is said to be critical following a road accident, had approached the CBI in June seeking transfer of her case to Delhi where she has been relocated. However, the CBI does not have the power to transfer cases. The case is being investigated by CBI's Lucknow unit and Delhi's special crime unit is assisting in the probe. CBI officials visited the survivor in hospital on Monday and have sought information about the case and probe from UP police as she is also the prime witness in the rape case. The CBI had filed its chargesheet on the basis of her testimony. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.According to the survivor, she was raped on June 4, 2017. Her father was booked under Arms Act on April 8 last year and sent to jail for allegedly possessing an illegal gun. On May 17 last year, the CBI arrested SHO of Makhi police station Ashok Singh Bhaduriya and sub-inspector Kamta Prasad Singh for planting a gun on the survivor's father. The survivor had attempted self-immolation outside the chief minister's residence in Lucknow on April 8 last year. Next day, her father died in hospital, after being attacked in the jail. The CBI had taken over the case on April 12 last year and four cases were subsequently filed. While the main case pertained to the sexual assault on a minor girl, the second case was on the assault and subsequent death of the survivor's father in jail. The third case pertained to allegations of gang rape by three men including an aide of Sengar and the fourth was the counter complaint lodged by the accused MLA's brother alleging assault by the survivor's kin. Top CommentThis is really so shameful , BJP do something..do you get the message. This girl has suffered so muchPeter ParkerSee All CommentsAdd commentOn July 7 and 11, 2018, the CBI filed its chargesheet in two of the cases. In the first case, the MLA and a woman were charged under offences of abduction and rape while in the second, the CBI charged five people for murder of the survivor's father. A third chargesheet was filed against the MLA and others in the case of planting of weapon on the survivor's father. On speculation that the case would go weak in the event of the survivor's death, CBI sources said they had collected ample evidence against the accused which had been elaborated in the chargesheet. "Her statement before a magistrate has already been recorded under 164 CrPC which will corroborate our evidence and statements of other witnesses," an official said.

column2: Jail guards may have tipped off MLA's aides, says uncle
column3: LUCKNOW: The Unnao rape survivor's condition deteriorated on Monday and she was put on ventilator support at King George's Medical University's (KGMU) Trauma Centre in Lucknow. Her lawyer has been on ventilator since Sunday and has suffered 13 fractures and head injuries. "The girl too has head injuries and fractures in her collar bone, ribs and thighs," said trauma surgery head Sandeep Tiwari. The rape survivor's mother was inconsolable. "It's a planned murder of my family. BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar will eliminate us. We received threats and informed police. We are living in fear," she told TOI. All through the day, politicians and social activists queued up to meet the rape survivor's family amidst heavy deployment of police and local intelligence personnel. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.DGP OP Singh and a CBI team also visited the hospital to enquire about the health of the rape survivor, who's a key witness in all four cases being probed by the agency. In his complaint, the survivor's uncle also demanded a CBI probe into the accident. The state government has begun the process. The complainant said his family, including the rape survivor were being threatened by Sengar's aides, but police did not register a case. Latest CommentSecurity was provided by police.,  By Court Order. It cannot be removed without Court Order. It had to be a conspiracy. Who in police authorized it?rsinghSee All CommentsAdd comment"Sengar's aides would often call my family members and threaten them to withdraw cases or face consequences. His henchman, Haripal Singh, often came to our house and told us to strike a compromise. I was shifted from Unnao to Rae Bareli jail, even though I wrote to prison authorities that my family would be vulnerable while travelling 115km by road to meet me," he said in his complaint. "I am sure Sengar ordered the truck owner and driver to kill my family," he said in the complaint. He also said prison guards had overheard his conversation with his wife on her last visit and tipped off Sengar's aides, who planned the attack and ensured the rape survivor's securitymen didn't accompany her. Guards deployed at the survivor's residence said they were asked to stay back due to space crunch in the car. Senior officials said they would probe the veracity of their statement.

column2: Unnao rape: No trial yet, chargesheet in fourth case hangs in balance
column3: LUCKNOW/NEW DELHI: The CBI had filed chargesheets against BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar in the Unnao rape case last year, but the trial is yet to begin. Sengar, MLA from Bangarmau in Unnao, is currently lodged in Sitapur district jail. The survivor had approached CBI in June seeking transfer of her case to Delhi where she has been relocated. However, CBI does not have the power to transfer cases. The case is being investigated by CBI’s Lucknow unit and Delhi’s special crime unit is assisting in the probe. column2: Lucknow: Student shoots self with dad’s licensed revolver
column3: LUCKNOW: A 19-year-old diploma student shot himself dead with his father’s licensed revolver in Dwarkapuri area of Indiranagar on Monday. Police have registered an abetment to suicide case against a girl who, his family members said, was harassing him for long. Abhishek Singh was pursuing a technical course from a private polytechnic. Around Monday noon, he locked himself in his room on the first floor of their house before shooting himself on the head. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“My son had gone out in the morning and came back around noon. He didn’t speak to anyone and went straight to his room. Within minutes, we heard a gunshot and rushed upstairs. His room was locked from inside. We called police,” father Jhallar Singh, a private contractor, wrote in his complaint. Police broke open the door to find Abhishek in a puddle of blood. The .315 bore licensed revolver, belonging to his father, lay beside the body. No suicide note was recovered, but police seized the teenager’s mobile phone. Ghazipur station house officer Brijesh Singh quoted the bereaved father as saying that the boy took the drastic step because a girl had been harassing him for long. The SHO said family members had not been able to substantiate the claim, but said they had heard Abhishek fighting with the girl over phone on a number of occasions. “Since the family has lodged a named complaint, we have registered a case of abetment against the girl. However, action will be taken only after her statement is recorded and a thorough investigation done,” the officer added.

column2: Two startup fraudsters cheque-mate Lucknow businessmen
column3: LUCKNOW: Posing as entrepreneurs with a new startup at Vibhuti Khand, Gomtinagar, they bought laptops from dealers in the city in lieu of post-dated cheques, which inevitably bounced but not before they were gone. The smart plan helped Nitin Bharadwaj of Haryana and Nathu Bairwa of Rajasthan successfully dupe three city wholesalers in two months before luck ran out on them on Monday when the cyber cell of Lucknow Police tracked them to Delhi. Circle officer, Hazratganj, AK Mishra said the two-member gang had opened a posh office at Cyber Heights (Levana) in Vibhuti Khand and purchased as many as 50 laptops from a businessman for employees of their purported startup. Latest CommentMera desh badal raha haiVibs sharmaSee All CommentsAdd comment"They issued only post-dated cheques, which later bounced. The victim contacted the said office, but could not reach the buyer. He lodged a complaint with police. Later, two more such complaints were lodged," Mishra said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The gang is said to have cheated two more dealers in the district in the past, police said.

column2: Lucknow: Iron rod drills skull, surgery saves man
column3: LUCKNOW: A 38-year-old man, who impaled himself upon an iron rod that pierced his skull, got a fresh lease of life following an eight-hour surgery at King George's Medical University (KGMU). Indiranagar resident Vijay Rawat, who works as an electrician, was brought to the trauma centre around 11.30pm on Sunday after an iron rod went four inches into his skull when he fell from a tree on a wall with an iron fence. A team of neurosurgeons, led by head of neurosurgery department professor BK Ojha, successfully removed the iron rod. The patient is, however, still unconscious and critical. "The rod had penetrated a significant part of the brain and damaged both sides of the frontal lobe. Whether he will be able to live a normal life or not can be ascertained once he regains consciousness," said professor Ojha. Skip

column2: UP: Train stops 50m from packed school van on railway tracks
column3: LUCKNOW: Close to a dozen children had a narrow escape on Monday morning when their school van got stuck on railway tracks. They were safely rescued, thanks to the alertness of the loco pilot of the train which stopped barely 50 metres from them. Following the incident, railways began a campaign against trespassing and violation of level crossing rules. The incident occurred near Akbarpur-Tanda railway crossing around 7am. The packed van headed to a private school had trespassed the restricted section of the railway tracks. From the other side, a goods train was approaching in normal speed. As the driver tried to move the van, its tyres got trapped between the tracks on the unpaved road. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The loco pilot saw the situation from 100 meters away and started honking repeatedly. However, when the van did not move, he applied emergency brakes. The train stopped just 50 meters before the van. Watching the approaching train, the schoolchildren started crying loudly. One student even tried to get out but failed to open the door. Luckily, all were safe. After the train stopped, the loco pilot and wagon supervisor came down and counselled the van driver for 10 minutes. They told him about this unmanned level crossing and alerted the control room. About 15 minutes later, the railway protection force (RPF) reached the spot. Northern Railway DRM for Lucknow Sanjay Tripathi said, "The van driver will be prosecuted for trespassing. There was no level crossing and he came on tracks illegally. I have ordered all stations and halts to run a campaign against trespassing and not violate level crossing rules."

column2: Unnao rape survivor’s condition worsens, put on ventilator
column3: LUCKNOW: The critically injured Unnao rape survivor was put on ventilator support after her health deteriorated further on Monday morning. Her lawyer Mahendra Singh is on ventilator since Sunday, after both were brought to KGMU Trauma Centre with multiple injuries they had sustained in the truck-car collision on Sunday afternoon. The rape survivor and her lawyer, both, needed blood transfusion, said doctors. “The girl has sustained internal injuries besides fractures in her collar bone, ribs and right thigh. The lawyer has head injury besides 13 fractures in all. Both are on ventilator and their condition remains critical,” said trauma surgery head, Prof Sandeep Tiwari. The survivor’s mother, who reached KGMU late Sunday night, also alleged conspiracy behind the accident and termed it a murder bid. Sitting outside the critical care unit on the third floor of Trauma Centre, an inconsolable mother of the survivor muttered in between sobs, “It was not an accident. It was a planned murder of my family. Kuldeep Singh Sengar (BJP MLA) will get my whole family killed. We had been receiving death threats and had informed police. We live in fear all the time.” NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Politicians and social activists came to the hospital to meet the rape survivor’s family and added to the crowd as a large number of police men and local intelligence staff crammed up the space. The rape survivor’s siblings, the youngest merely six years of age, and relatives had taken refuge in the cramped hallway and ramp of Trauma Centre. While officials said that all medical expenses will be borne by government, a relative of the survivor said, “I have paid Rs 14,000 for medicines and diagnostic tests since Sunday afternoon and have all bills as proof.” Top CommentIf Modi wants Yogi to survive long haul, he should punish the MLA severely MaverickSee All CommentsAdd commentDelhi Women Commission chairperson, Swati Maliwal said, “We have written to chief minister Yogi Adityanath and requested government to shift them to Delhi for better treatment.” “The Unnao rape trial should be held under Supreme Court’s supervision,” she added.

column2: Roses & traffic thorns welcome kanwars in Ghaziabad
column3: GHAZIABAD: The road in Ghaziabad that leads to Haridwar was chock-a-block with kanwar pilgrims on Monday. Hundreds of kanwariyas, carrying Ganga water from Haridwar, made the difficult journey on bikes, trucks and barefoot to arrive in the city a day before Shivratri. The stretch up to Muradnagar was a sea of pilgrims with numerous camps set up by the road for devotees to take rest and access other facilities. Among them was Chaitanya, who, at a little over a year old, was one of the youngest kanwariyas. At the end of the journey, he looked tired and sleepy in a pram even as his parents dragged it laboriously. “Four days ago, we started our return journey from Haridwar on foot. My wife and I have been taking turns to drag the pram,” said Monu, Chaitanya’s father. “We are happy we reached Ghaziabad a day before Shivratri. We will be offering prayers and Ganga water in the city’s Dudheshwar Nath temple on Tuesday,” he added. Meanwhile, the toughest of kanwariyas, also called dak kanwars, sprinted non-stop with a baton in hand, wrapped in saffron cloth. “The custom is, anyone who holds the baton with Ganga water in it will have to run barefoot all along the journey from Haridwar,” said Satish Chauhan. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“Four of us took turns to carry the Ganga water while the others took rest in an open vehicle ,” he added. There are some kanwariyas who were racing past each other on bikes, making a deafening sound. The police and officials from the administration offered no resistance to them. Instead, they were seen guiding them and making way for them by clearing the stretch meant for pedestrians. Latest CommentNO DEVELOPMENT AS PROMISED BY LIAR PM MODI BUT WE ARE HERE TO SEE ALL SUCH NONSENSE TAKING PLACE DAY IN AND DAY OUT WITH POLICE AND STATE ADMINISTRATION INVOLVED IN IT WHICH IS HIGHLY SHAMEFUL  !  WH...Read MoreFranky DesouzaSee All CommentsAdd commentBut the most attention-seeking part of the journey are the open vehicles and trucks that have loudspeakers blarinf. On Monday, kanwariyas were seen dancing to Bollywood tunes, lyrics of which have been fashioned into devotional songs. Mohit Singh, one of the kanwariyas, explains, “The journey is like a penance as it tests one’s physical endurance. The songs are just a way to keep us going. The Ghaziabad administration, meanwhile, has marshalled all of its resources for kanwariyas. District magistrate Ajay Shankar Pandey and SSP Sudhir Kumar Singh boarded a chopper and showered rose petals on kanwariyas along the road .

column2: Filed 35 complaints but police didn't act: Unnao rape survivor's kin
column3: LUCKNOW: A relative of the Unnao rape survivor revealed to TOI on Tuesday that the family had sent 35 written complaints to the local police and administration in the last one year expressing fear that they would be targeted by the henchmen of jailed BJP MLA and rape-accused Kuldeep Singh Sengar. However, no action was taken by the police, the relative said. "We've been living in fear and continued facing life threats ever since the CBI took over the case last year and arrested the MLA. There is so much fear that we even left our house in Makhi in Unnao district," the relative said. Unnao victim had written letter to CJI before accident about threat perceptionThese revelations - coming on a day when Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi sought a report on a letter written to him by the survivor's family members alleging threats from Sengar - have put UP police in a fix and jolted them into action. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.BJP MLA Sengar charged with murder after Unnao rape survivor's accidentUnnao SP MP Verma admitted police received 33 complaints. "But they were dismissed as they were unfounded and lacked merit," he said. However, his senior, additional director general of police (Lucknow zone) Rajeev Krishna, struck a different note saying that the complaints would now be re-examined. Top CommentThis rapist must be arrested and should be hanged in public.... AnilSee All CommentsAdd comment"We will reassess all complaints filed by the kin of the rape survivor since last one year. If any laxity of district police comes to the fore, action will be initiated against the guilty," he told TOI. "IGP (Lucknow range) SK Bhagat was sent to Unnao district on Monday night to reassess all complaints given by the family," he added. Elaborating on the complaints, the relative said they were sent through registered post and even uploaded on the government's integrated grievance redressal system (IGRS). "Sengar's henchmen even came in the presence of security guards and threatened us. We made videos of these incidents and showed them to police, but the Makhi SHO did not register a case," he said.

column2: IIM Lucknow goes green for its Foundation Day
column3: Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Lucknow, recently celebrated its 35th Foundation Day. It was exactly 35 years back on July 27 that the foundation stone was laid for the institution. Students and faculty of IIM-Lucknow along with the director Dr Archana Shukla (in green salwar-suit), planting a sapling (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Students and faculty of IIM-Lucknow along with the director Dr Archana Shukla (in green salwar-suit), planting a sapling (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) To mark the special day, a tree plantation drive was held in the morning on campus in which more than 200 trees with medicinal properties, including Neem, Jamun and Mahuha, were planted. The drive was started by Dr Archana Shukla, the Director of the institute, who planted a Neem sapling on campus. Others, including the faculty, staff and students also joined in and went on to plant more than 200 saplings across the sprawling campus. Prof Archna Shukla, Prof Sanjay Singh and Prof Neeraj Dwivedi (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  Prof Archna Shukla, Prof Sanjay Singh and Prof Neeraj Dwivedi (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Speaking about the drive, Dr Archana Shukla, said, "Saving the environment is the most important agenda today, globally. IIM Lucknow has always believed in focusing on saving the environment, be it creating and maintaining the green cover or recycling of water or rainwater harvesting. This drive had a specific reason too. Since in the coming three months, IIM Lucknow would be focusing on infrastructure development, a necessity to cater to future infrastructure requirements, this drive was compensatory plantation to minimise the effect of construction in the coming months." (L) Prof Kishtij Awasthi and Brig Dinesh Sharma (R) Pankaj Lingayat (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) (L) Prof Kishtij Awasthi and Brig Dinesh Sharma (R) Pankaj Lingayat (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) She added that further, the institute plans to focus on creating exclusive areas for Medicinal plants to create awareness for the same as well as a step towards conservation. R K Verma, Ananya singh and Vatsala Singh (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  R K Verma, Ananya singh and Vatsala Singh (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Tanishka and Prem Prakash Dewani (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  Tanishka and Prem Prakash Dewani (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)

column2: A play depicting the life journey of Gautam Buddha staged in Lucknow
column3: A play titled 'Mahayatra' was staged at Sangeet Natak Akademi, recently. Through the play director, Lalit Singh Pokhariya beautifully depicted the life journey of Gautam Buddha. Depiction of how Siddhartha left his palace to gain enlightenment and become Buddha was depicted in the play. (L) Divya and Priyanshi (R) Anshika Trivedi (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) (L) Divya and Priyanshi (R) Anshika Trivedi (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Lalit Singh Pokhariya, who has been working in theatre for the past 34 years, said, "I have noticed how people in today’s generation are material-centric, they hardly care about real emotions and human values. They have forgotten to cherish simple pleasures and values in life. So, through this play, I want to remind people about Buddha and his teachings. I want people to live in the present and value what they already have, like the people they are blessed to have, rather than running after material things." (L) Lalit Singh Pokhariya (C) Sandeep Yadav (R) Tarun Raj (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  (L) Lalit Singh Pokhariya (C) Sandeep Yadav (R) Tarun Raj (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) The play consisted of about 23 characters who portrayed their characters well. Although the play was long, it managed to keep the audience glued to their seats till the very end. Kamya, a high school student said, "It was wonderful to get to know about the journey and preachings of lord Buddha. How he educated the people. It was so nice to see it being depicted up close." (L) Tushar and Gaurav (R) Urmil Kumar Thapliyal (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) (L) Tushar and Gaurav (R) Urmil Kumar Thapliyal (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) "I think the performance by the characters in this play was just phenomenal. The way they depicted the life of Buddha was just too good," said, Adarsh Dwivedi, a collegian. The characters of the play had been rehearsing for over 45 days. The theatre was flocked by people who wanted to learn about lord Buddha and his principles. Artistes entertained the audience not just by reciting dialogues but also singing songs in a symphony. — Yashi Agarwal (L) Apoorva (R) Gopal Sinha (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  (L) Apoorva (R) Gopal Sinha (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)

column2: In a 1st, CJI allows CBI to file case against HC judge
column3: NEW DELHI: In an unprecedented decision, Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi on Tuesday gave permission to the CBI to register a case (FIR) against sitting Allahabad high court judge Justice SN Shukla under the Prevention of Corruption Act for alleged favours to a private medical college for MBBS admissions. Nearly 30 years ago, the apex court in the K Veeraswamy case on July 25, 1991 had prevented any investigating agency from lodging an FIR against a sitting Supreme Court or HC judge without first showing the evidence to the CJI for permission to investigate the judge. Powered By                          10 Sec      Bangladesh deploys border guards after deadly anti-Modi protests	.stlp0{fill:#FF3E5F;}	.st1{fill:#fffffe;}	.st2{fill:#FF3E5F;}         .clsx-1{isolation:isolate;}.clsx-2{fill:#ff3e5f;}.clsx-3{fill:#fff;}NextStay     Bangladesh deploys border guards after deadly anti-Modi protestsNOW  PLAYINGWork to Re-Float Stuck Boat in Suez Canal SuspendedNOW  PLAYINGIndian farmers dance to mark four months of protestsNOW  PLAYINGStuck Ship in Suez Canal Holds Up Oil and LNG ShipmentsNOW  PLAYINGIndia tells overseas vaccine buyers it must prioritise local needNOW  PLAYINGIndia orders deportation of migrants who fled Myanmar military coupNOW  PLAYINGThe secret network helping Myanmar police fleeNOW  PLAYINGBlocked Suez Forces Ships to Look at Long Trip Around AfricaNOW  PLAYINGSuez Canal Not Expected to Open Anytime SoonNOW  PLAYINGAt least four dead in Bangladesh Modi protestsNOW  PLAYING  Arrow Left #1 Icon Created with Sketch.                 Arrow right #1 Icon Created with Sketch.               Before 1991, no investigating agency had ever probed a sitting HC judge and this is the first time since then that the CJI granted permission to an investigating agency to lodge an FIR against a sitting judge. The CBI will soon register a case against Justice Shukla, an ignominious development that will get aggravated by the possibility of his arrest under the PC Act. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.The investigating agency had written to CJI Gogoi to seek permission to investigate Justice Shukla in the case. Seeking permission to probe Allahabad HC judge SN Shukla, the CBI director had written to the CJI saying, "Aforementioned preliminary enquiry (PE) was registered by the CBI against Justice Sri Narayan Shukla of the high court of Allahabad, Lucknow bench, Uttar Pradesh, and others on the advice of the then CJI (Dipak Misra) when the matter regarding alleged misconduct of Justice Shukla was brought to his knowledge." Attaching a brief note on the PE with a chronological chart, the CBI director had said, "If deemed appropriate, permission may be granted to initiate a regular case for investigation." After perusing the material, the CJI wrote to the CBI director, "I have considered the note appended to your letter on the above subject. In the facts and circumstances of the case, I am constrained to grant permission to initiate a regular case for investigation as sought for in your letter under reference." Last month, CJI Gogoi had written to PM Narendra Modi for moving a motion in Parliament for removal of Justice Shukla, an action first recommended 19 months ago by then CJI Misra after an in-house inquiry panel found him guilty of serious judicial irregularities. Prior to writing to Modi, CJI Gogoi rejected Justice Shukla's request for re-allocation of judicial work, which was withdrawn from him on January 22, 2018, following his indictment by the in-house panel. On a September 2017 complaint of UP advocate general Raghvendra Singh alleging malpractices against Justice Shukla, then CJI Misra had set up a panel comprising then Madras HC CJ Indira Banerjee, then Sikkim HC CJ SK Agnihotri and MP HC's Justice PK Jaiswal to inquire into alleged favours shown by Justice Shukla to a private medical college by extending deadline for admission of students in violation of an SC order. The panel concluded that "there is sufficient substance in the allegations contained in the complaints against Justice Shukla and the aberrations complained of are serious enough to call for initiation of proceedings for his removal". It had also said Justice Shukla had "disgraced the values of judicial life, acted in a manner unbecoming of a judge" to lower the "majesty, dignity and credibility of his office" and acted in breach of his oath of office. After receiving the panel's report, then CJI Misra had asked Justice Shukla to either resign or seek voluntary retirement. Top CommentIn my indepedent view more than half of  high court judges are corrupt and some time think how they were hired in first place ,75 % lower cort judges are corrupt ,so as police .I can not say about SC...Read MorePatriotSee All CommentsAdd commentBut Justice Shukla declined to do either. Read this story in Marathi

column2: CJI seeks report on Unnao rape survivor's letter
column3: NEW DELHI: Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi on Tuesday sought a report on a letter written to him by the Unnao rape survivor's sister, mother and aunt, who alleged that MLA Kuldip Singh Sengar's kin had threatened them with dire consequences if they did not settle the sexual assault case with the accused. Ironically, the letter by the three women was dated July 12, a fortnight before the aunt, Pushpa Singh, one of the prime witnesses in the case, died in a road accident. The police have registered a case against Sengar on allegations that he had a role in the suspected plot to kill the rape survivor and her relatives. While two aunts were killed in the accident, the rape survivor and her lawyer suffered critical injuries and are admitted to hospital. The letter was placed before the CJI on Tuesday and he immediately asked secretary general Sanjeev S Kalgaonkar to furnish a report with a detailed note on this issue, SC sources told TOI. Top CommentIn summary:- she was raped- her father died in police custody- her uncle went to jail for a case filed by her rapist’s brother - quick justice there- her two aunts died in the car...Read MoreStrong VoiceSee All CommentsAdd commentIn the letter, the three women had alleged that Sengar's brother Manoj Singh and one Kunnu Mishra, along with another accused Shashi Singh's son Naveen Singh and two other unknown persons, on July 7 came in a car to their house in Makhi village and threatened that "they could buy out the judges to get accused Kuldip Singh and Shashi Singh out on bail and send the rape survivor and her relatives to jail on the charge of filing false case". NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Their complaint annexed mobile phone video footage of the two incidents of July 7 and July 8, which was sent to the CJI, chief justice of Allahabad HC, administrative judge of Lucknow bench of the HC, UP home secretary, DGP, CBI and Unnao.

column2: Unnao rape survivor accident: Initial forensic finding say truck skidded, hit car
column3: LUCKNOW: The truck which hit the car carrying the Unnao rape survivor, her two aunts and their lawyer was moving at 70 kmph and possibly skidded on the road that was wet due to rain, said forensic experts on Tuesday, citing their preliminary findings. The initial findings of the forensic team reaffirm the claims of the police brass which had said that the car crash appears to be a mishap. SkipExperts from Forensic Science Laboratory's Lucknow and Rae Bareli units inspected the crash site and the damaged car and truck on Monday besides recreating the crime scene. "Prima facie, it appears that the 12-wheeled truck was travelling at 70kmph. When the car came near it, it skidded, resulting in the crash," a member of the FSL team said. He added that there is a blind turn at the spot and there was no warning signboard or speed-breaker, "which could have been a factor behind the crash". NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy."The pattern of skid marks lifted from the spot shows that the truck was speeding. The depression on the car's body, damage caused to it and its paint on the truck body have also been analysed," the expert added. Top CommentOperation Damage Control has commenced! Shame on Yogi and  the BJP!Mani MenonSee All CommentsAdd commentIG (Lucknow range) SK Bhagat told TOI that it would be hasty to draw any conclusion and refused to comment on the findings. UP police have also constituted a three-member SIT to probe the case. "The team would also include three DySPs. It will probe the crash and the charges levelled by the Unnao survivor's family against the BJP MLA and his henchmen," said IG (law and order), Praveen Kumar.

column2: Suspended Kuldeep Sengar, says BJP, but has no proof
column3: LUCKNOW: A day after Unnao rape case accused, BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar, was booked for criminal conspiracy to eliminate the survivor in the horrific car crash, the party was quick to disown him on Tuesday. It said he was suspended from BJP last year. Even as UP BJP chief Swatantra Dev Singh reiterated that action had been taken against the four-time MLA after his arrest in April, 2018, he failed to produce proof or provide the date of suspension. Top CommentWhy Yogi and Modi govt are hesitating in taking few honest steps to punish this criminal? Seems like Beti Bachao slogan is only for voting time. column2: Realtor brothers shot at, injured on busy VIP road in Hazratganj
column3: LUCKNOW: Two brothers — both property dealers — were shot at and injured by unidentified men on a VIP stretch of Hazratganj, a stone’s throw from the SSP’s camp office, on Tuesday evening when the place was bustling with commuters. Friends of the victims tried chasing the two assailants, who came on a bike, but the latter opened fire once more and escaped. Police have recovered four empty cartridges from the spot and are looking for two men riding a particular sports bike. Shahid Jafri (50) and Namwar Jafri (42), residents of Wazirganj, took a bullet each but were saved by doctors at KGMU Trauma Centre. Their condition is said to be stable. According to eyewitnesses, the incident took place around 6.30pm. The brothers had just left a lounge on Habibullah Estate Road and were biking towards Shahnajaf road when the assailants appeared from behind a tree and shot at them from close range. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Namwar was driving and took a bullet on the shoulder. Shahid was riding pillion and a bullet hit him on the back. Despite being wounded, Namwar sped towards the SSP camp office, where policemen on duty came to their rescue.Umar Shahid, an eyewitness whose family owns the lounge, mustered courage and managed to capture the fleeing assailants on camera. “The two had just left the lounge when we heard gunshots. We tried chasing the bikers, but they fired on us too. They were not wearing masks. One even dropped his helmet while escaping,” Umar told police. Cop, don accusedShahid’s friend Asif Rizvi, also an eyewitness, said the brothers had come to the lounge for lunch and stayed till evening. One of the assailants was dressed in black, he said. The duo sped towards Halwasiya market. Hazratganj CO Abhay Mishra told TOI the victims had in their statement mentioned an old rivalry with mafia don-turned-politician Dhananjay Singh of Jaunpur. “A named FIR has been lodged against Singh and suspended cop Alok Singh,” he added.

column2: Truck skidded on wet road, hit car: Forensic experts
column3: LUCKNOW: The truck, which hit the car carrying Unnao rape survivor, her two aunts and lawyer, was moving at 70 km/hour and possibly skidded on the wet road in rainfall, said forensic experts citing their preliminary findings onTuesday. Experts from the forensic science laboratory (FSL) Lucknow and the Rae Bareli unit inspected the crash site on Monday, inspected the damaged car and truck and carried out a crime scene recreation. The experts also measured the tyre marks of the truck and the car from the spot where the crash took place for further analysis and investigation. A FSL team member, who visited the spot, told TOI, "Prima facie, it appears that the 12-wheeled truck was travelling at 70km/hr. When the car came in its path, it skidded and the crashed resulted." "There is a blind turn at the spot and there was no warning sign board or speed-breaker, which could be a contributing factor for the accident," the forensic team member added. "The pattern of skid marks lifted from the spot shows that the truck was speeding. The depression on car, damage caused to it and its paint on truck body have also been analysed," the expert added. IG (Lucknow range) S K Bhagat told TOI that it would be hasty to draw any conclusions from the preliminary findings of forensic team and refused to comment. Three-member Special Investigation Team set up under an additional superintendent of police rank officer of Rae Bareli district. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy."The team would also include three DySPs. It will probe the crash and the charges levelled by the Unnao survivor's family against the BJP MLA and his henchmen," said IG (law and order), Praveen Kumar. The initial findings of the forensic team reaffirm the claims of police brass, which had said that the crash appears to be a mishap.

column2: Lucknow: More than 5,000 government buses to be made disabled-friendly by year-end
column3: LUCKNOW: Buses will be more comfortable for the differently abled now. In a recent board meeting of UPSRTC, it was decided that bus depots and buses in the state will be made friendly for the differently able passengers. In the first phase, inter-city buses (type-II), are getting additional features to make buses compliant for differently able passengers. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.By the end of this financial year, at least 5,000 inter-city buses will be made compliant. In each bus, at least four seats will be reserved for ‘divyang’ passengers. A pictogram on the seat will depict if it is reserved. Besides, crutch holders will be provided inside the bus. “We had started introducing the features two years ago,” said an official. As of now, at least 3,000 buses are already compliant,” said CGM (technical), UPSRTC, Jaideep Verma. The type-II buses, however, have a height of 1,100mm, which makes it difficult to provide a ramp. A ramp though is being provided at the depots.

column2: 63 LDA colonies to enjoy civic services for a fee
column3: LUCKNOW: As many as 63 residential neighbourhoods in different parts of the city with a combined population of over 10 lakh will now get civic amenities on payment of user charges. The Lucknow Development Authority (LDA) board on Tuesday approved Rs 226 crore for road construction and repair, street lightning, cleaning of drains, catching stray animals and garbage disposal in these colonies along Kanpur Road and Sultanpur Road, at Shardanagar extension, and in parts of Gomtinagar and Jankipuram extensions, said LDA secretary Mangla Prasad Singh. These residential areas were developed between 2011 and 2014, but have not been taken over by the Lucknow Municipal Corporation. As a result, residents had to hire private agencies for cleaning of drains and garbage disposal. Roads and street lights are in bad shape in almost all the localities. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Now, the LDA will seek user charges to provide them these services. The charges will be equivalent to LMC rates so that in the future people don’t have to face problems if jurisdiction of these colonies is transferred to the civic body. The proposal was part of the LDA budget approved at the board meeting. A total budget of Rs 2,259 crore was passed for the financial year 2019-20. Of this, around 25% funds will be used for development and repair work in the colonies developed by LDA.

column2: Lucknow: School van owners on strike today
column3: LUCKNOW: School van owners and drivers have decided to go on strike on Wednesday in protest against the new guidelines issued for operators by a seven member committee, headed by the district magistrate. The committee had instructed that a school committee comprising school administration, parents and officials should be formed to ensure that school vans follow guidelines. The school committees were instructed to hold a meeting on July 31. Latest CommentHope matters resolve today. Most people here coming from trying backgrounds send children to schools to get educated. People helping them out are the van operators. It becomes a complex situation for...Read MoreBiding OnSee All CommentsAdd commentThe school van operators’ association decided to strike against new guidelines which, according to them, are not feasible. According to RTO officials, around 2,500 school vans ply in the city. Of these, around 80% are not eligible under the new guidelines. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.

column2: Unnao rape case: Truck owner is kin of former SP neta
column3: KANPUR: In a fresh political twist to allegations that jailed BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar plotted the car-crash in which the rape survivor’s vehicle was hit by a truck, it has surfaced that the truck owner’s brother was a former Samajwadi Party leader.  The disclosure came as a blessing in disguise for ruling BJP, which accused the SP of defaming BJP to save its cadre. BJP MPs Jagdambika Pal and Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti, while speaking on the issue in Parliament said, despite the truck driver’s clear links with Samajwadi Party, it was trying to defame BJP.  Investigations into the car-crash led police to Devendra Pal of Fatehpur district, who owns the truck involved in the accident. Devendra is the brother of Nand Kishore Pal alias Nandu Pal, who joined Samajwadi Party in 2001. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy. Nand Kishore’s wife Ramashri became block pramukh of Asothar in Fatehpur district in 2011 with SP support.  However, when SP chief Akhilesh Yadav’s uncle Shivpal parted ways and floated Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia (PSP-L), Nand Kishore sided with the latter. He is currently the Fatehpur district secretary of PSP-L.  Neighbours of Nand Kishore and Devendra, who live on Jail Road in Fatehpur, said the brother duo own 27 trucks. Top Commentevery person is either a neta or a kin of a neta in UP ......north Indians are good at politics .....kripashanker was homeminister in Maharashtra .....😀😀😀😀😀😀😀😀😀😀😀JollySee All CommentsAdd comment “They are into the transport business for decades. They also own a restaurant in Lalauli area of the district, which has now shut, and a brick-kiln unit on Lucknow-Kanpur highway,” said a neighbour of Pals, talking to TOI on phone.  Nand Kishore Pal, however, denied links with Sengar and said it was an accident. He, however, admitted the registration plate of the truck was smeared with grease to evade scrutiny by the financer who funded the vehicle as he failed to pay the last instalment. “Our demand from government is to order a CBI probe and let the truth come out," he said.

column3: KANPUR: In a fresh political twist to allegations that jailed BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar plotted the car-crash in which the rape survivor’s vehicle was hit by a truck, it has surfaced that the truck owner’s brother was a former Samajwadi Party leader.  The disclosure came as a blessing in disguise for ruling BJP, which accused the SP of defaming BJP to save its cadre.
