BJP MPs Jagdambika Pal and Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti, while speaking on the issue in Parliament said, despite the truck driver’s clear links with Samajwadi Party, it was trying to defame BJP.  Investigations into the car-crash led police to Devendra Pal of Fatehpur district, who owns the truck involved in the accident. Devendra is the brother of Nand Kishore Pal alias Nandu Pal, who joined Samajwadi Party in 2001. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy. Nand Kishore’s wife Ramashri became block pramukh of Asothar in Fatehpur district in 2011 with SP support.  However, when SP chief Akhilesh Yadav’s uncle Shivpal parted ways and floated Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia (PSP-L), Nand Kishore sided with the latter. He is currently the Fatehpur district secretary of PSP-L.  Neighbours of Nand Kishore and Devendra, who live on Jail Road in Fatehpur, said the brother duo own 27 trucks. Top Commentevery person is either a neta or a kin of a neta in UP ......north Indians are good at politics .....kripashanker was homeminister in Maharashtra .....😀😀😀😀😀😀😀😀😀😀😀JollySee All CommentsAdd comment “They are into the transport business for decades. They also own a restaurant in Lalauli area of the district, which has now shut, and a brick-kiln unit on Lucknow-Kanpur highway,” said a neighbour of Pals, talking to TOI on phone.  Nand Kishore Pal, however, denied links with Sengar and said it was an accident. He, however, admitted the registration plate of the truck was smeared with grease to evade scrutiny by the financer who funded the vehicle as he failed to pay the last instalment. “Our demand from government is to order a CBI probe and let the truth come out," he said.

column2: Roaches ride Lucknow Mail, viral video makes DRM act
column3: LUCKNOW: A video clip showing cockroaches crawling all over an AC-III coach of Lucknow Mail has gone viral and prompted the Northern Railway authorities to terminate the contract of a private agency hired for pest control. A government agency, Central Warehousing Corporation, has now been entrusted with the task. The 34-second clip was recorded and tweeted by Dr Narinder Kaur on Sunday night on her way to New Delhi from Lucknow. Kaur who was originally booked in an AC-II coach played good Samaritan for a lady who had a reserved berth in AC-III. She was obviously unaware that the exchange of seats would prove to be a nightmare. Twitter erupted over the video, with many passengers posting stinkers on their infamous railway journeys with roaches as well as rodents. The viral clip and posts prompted the official Twitter handle of Indian Railways Seva (passenger support) to forward Kaur's grievances to DRM of Northern Railway's Lucknow division. "The complaint was attended to as soon as it came to our notice. We have terminated the licence of the previous agency and hired a government body, Central Warehousing Corporation, which is one of the best agencies to minimise the rodent problem," said DRM Sanjay Tripathi. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Nevertheless, several other travellers opened up to TOI about pest peril on trains. Banker Mehak Chaudhary said pest control happened only on paper. "There was this one time when I stayed awake all night with a rat scurrying around under my seat," she recalled.

column2: OPDs shut at private hospitals today in Lucknow over nod to NMC Bill
column3: LUCKNOW: Outpatient services across 1,000 nursing homes, private hospitals, pathology clinics and diagnostic centres in the city will remain suspended on Wednesday as part of a nationwide strike called by the Indian Medical Association (IMA) to protest against the enactment of the National Medical Commission (NMC) Bill, 2019, which allows AYUSH practitioners to prescribe modern medicines.  The strike may also impact services at King George's Medical University and Sanjay Gandhi Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences (SGPGI). IMA's Lucknow chapter secretary Dr JD Rawat said all the 1,500 members of the association, which includes KGMU and SGPGIMS doctors, will boycott services, except emergency duty, for 24 hours from 6am. SkipThe IMA has 180 members at KGMU and 40 at SGPGI. Latest CommentJanakpant, abb bimaron ka kya hoga ."Janak PantSee All CommentsAdd commentTeachers' outfits of KGMU and SGPGI have announced that their members will not participate in the strike although some may wear black bands or badges in solidarity. Spokesperson for KGMU teachers' association Dr Santosh Kumar said, "We will not boycott work, but wear black bands." NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy. Nevertheless, the strike in the private sector will increase the burden on government hospitals and clinics. Chief medical officer, Lucknow, Dr Nagendra Agarwal said all hospitals had been put on alert and doctors asked to report for duty.

column2: Back in Mumbai, former UP governor Ram Naik rejoins BJP as ‘worker’
column3: LUCKNOW: Former UP governor Ram Naik resumed political activities “like a common party worker” by registering himself again as a BJP member on Tuesday. The 85-year-old who retired from Raj Bhawan on Monday went to his native place in Mumbai from where he had been a five-time MP and three-time MLA. He flagged off the chariot of Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis who will be embarking on a rath yatra for the forthcoming election campaign. Ram Naik announced that he would not sit idle at home after retirement from Raj Bhawan. The two-time Union minister said he would work for the party “like any other party worker” and complete whatever assignments were handed over to him. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Maharashtra state BJP president and revenue minister Chandrakant Patil welcomed Ram Naik, saying he was “a great source of inspiration for the younger generation” because he worked hard and defeated the barriers of age. Patil later named him as a special member of the state executive of the BJP.

column2: UP: BJP chief disowns Kuldeep Sengar, claims MLA suspended long ago
column3: LUCKNOW: A day after BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar was booked for criminal conspiracy to eliminate the Unnao rape survivor in the horrific car crash, 15km from Rae Bareli prison, the party was quick to disown him, saying Sengar was suspended from BJP last year after he was embroiled in the rape case. Late Monday, the government referred the probe into the accident to CBI. Though state BJP chief Swatantra Dev Singh on Tuesday reiterated that action had been taken against the four-time MLA after his arrest in April, 2018, he failed to produce proof or date of suspension. Skip"As state BJP president, I confirm Senger was suspended last year. Also, the Y-category security cover provided to him was immediately withdrawn. The government is providing all help to family of the injured," Swatantra Dev Singh told TOI. However, the state BJP chief failed to justify why the suspended BJP leader's wife Sangeeta Sengar shared the dais with chief minister Yogi Adityanath at a poll rally by Sakshi Maharaj in Unnao in run-up to Lok Sabha elections. Also, to a pointed query on BJP MP Sakshi Maharaj's high-profile visit to Sitapur jail to thank Sengar for his support after his poll victory, the state BJP president refused to comment. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Sengar, a Rajput leader, enjoys considerable influence over Unnao and has a criminal history. He faces charges of disobedience to order promulgated by public servant (IPC Section-188) and assault to deter public servant from discharge of his duty. BJP sources said Sengar was served a show-cause notice after party's disciplinary action committee recommended his suspension for six years. Singh said immediately after his arrest, a CBI inquiry was sought by the state government. The agency in its charge-sheet filed against Sengar in July last year, booked him under Sections 120B, 363, 366, 376(1) and 506 of IPC and also under relevant sections of Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POSCO) Act. On Tuesday Congress staged a demonstration outside BJP office in Lucknow demanding sacking of Sengar from the party. SP chief Akhilesh Yadav too visited KGMU Trauma Centre to meet the survivor's family.

column2: Survivor’s uncle gets parole for wife’s funeral
column3: LUCKNOW: The Lucknow bench of Allahabad high court on Tuesday granted oneday parole to rape survivor’s uncle Mahesh Singh to attend the last rites of his wife who was killed in the road accident on Sunday. A bench of Justice Mohd FA Khan directed the superintendent of Rae Bareli district jail to allow Singh to perform the last rites of his wife at Gangaghat in Unnao on Wednesday. The court directed Rae Bareli DM and SSP to ensure tight security for Mahesh Singh during parole. SkipThe court directed officials to bring Singh back to the jail by Wednesday evening after the cremation. Singh’s wife was travelling with the Unnao rape survivor when their car was hit by a speeding truck in Rae Bareli. She was declared brought dead at KGMU Singh is serving a sentence in an attempt to murder case. His appeal against the conviction is pending in high court. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.

column2: After junking 33 complaints, police ready to re-examine
column3: LUCKNOW: UP Police on Tuesday decided to re-examine as many as 33 complaints filed by the kin of the rape survivor filed over 12 months. This comes on a day Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi sought a report on a letter written by her mother, sister and aunt, alleging threats from accused MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar. A relative of the Unnao rape survivor told TOI, they had sent 35 written complaints to police and administration since July 2018, expressing fear of being targeted by Sengar’s henchmen. Police had dismissed all complaints as ‘unfounded’ and ‘lacking merit’. A relative of rape survivor told TOI, “We have been living in fear and continued facing threats to life ever since CBI took over the case and arrested the MLA. There was so much pressure and fear that we even left our house in Makhi, Unnao.” “We sent written applications through registered post, and even complained on the Integrated Grievance Redressal System (IGRS) portal of government,” he added. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.“Sengar’s henchmen even came in presence of security guards and threatened us. We made videos of these incidents and showed them to police, but Makhi SHO did not register a case,” he said. Unnao superintendent of police, M P Verma said 33 complaints were given by the survivor’s family but they had no merit and were dismissed. However, additional director general of police (Lucknow Zone) Rajeev Krishna told TOI, “We will reassess all complaints filed by the kin of Unnao rape survivor since last one year. If any laxity of district police comes to the fore during reassessment then action will be initiated against the guilty,” he said. “Inspector general of police (Lucknow range) S K Bhagat was sent to the district on Monday night to reassess all the complaints given by the Unnao rape survivor’s family,” Krishna added.

column2: Yogi Adityanath calls on new governor Anandiben Patel
column3: LUCKNOW: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday met new governor Anandiben Patel at Raj Bhawan and briefed her about the state and central government’s plans and programmes for Uttar Pradesh. It was the first courtesy call by the CM to governor after her swearing-in ceremony on Monday. Their meeting continued for over an hour. Latest CommentJanakpant, badhaai ho, u.p.walo, ek yogi, mukhye mantri, aur strishakti, governor. Kalyaan hoga.Janak PantSee All CommentsAdd commentLater, Anandiben also met Raj Bhawan officials. Taking a round of Raj Bhawan, she also went to gaushala(cowshed) and offered roti(bread) and gur(jaggery) to cows. The governor also announced opening of Raj Bhawan for the public between 4 pm and 6 pm on Tuesday and Saturday and between 9 am and 5 pm from Monday to Friday for students. column2: Gunshots in heart of Lucknow leave shoppers in shock
column3: LUCKNOW: The shooting near Shahnajaf Road on Tuesday evening triggered panic in the area dotted with shops, restaurants, lounges and banks. Anuj Gupta, who had come to shop with his friend, said they had never encountered such a situation. “We are still in a state of shock. Hazratganj is in the heart of the city and is supposed to be a high-security zone,” he said. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Businessman Saurabh Shukla was shopping with his children when the bullets flew. “We rushed home as soon as we heard the gunshots. We have seen such scenes only in movies.” Surbhi Sharma, a student, was returning from a coaching institute. “If someone can be shot at near the SSP office, no place in the city is safe,” she said

column2: High-speed Wi-Fi in Northern Railway trains soon
column3: LUCKNOW: Passengers will get high-speed wi-fi internet facility at all the railway stations under Lucknow division of Northern Railway (NR) from September.  Of 158 railway stations in Lucknow division, 18 including Lucknow, Varanasi, Ayodhya, Faizabad, Prayag, Rae Bareli, Sultanpur and Unnao are already getting the service. SkipWhile installation at 44 other stations has been completed, work at remaining stations began on Tuesday. The net speed will be 72 megabyte per second (MBps), equivalent to 4G or above. Each platform will have 2-3 access points for full coverage. Divisional railway manager (NR), Lucknow division, Sanjay Tripathi said work was being carried out by RailTel Corporation of India Limited (RailTel), a Government of India enterprise. column2: Awanish Awasthi made additional chief secreatary home
column3: LUCKNOW: In a late night bureaucratic reshuffle on Tuesday, the state government shifted additional chief secretary Awanish Awasthi as the new additional chief secretary home. He has replaced principal secretary home Arvind Kumar, who has been moved to the transport department in the same capacity. The move saw 26 IAS officers being shuffled. Deepak Trivedi, additional chief secretary planning and programme implementation, is now director, Revenue Council. Rajendra Kumar Tiwari, additional chief secretary secondary and higher education, is the new agriculture production commissioner, a post which has been lying vacant for several months. column2: After 16 years, is it finally homecoming for Sanjay Sinh?
column3: LUCKNOW: Since the beginning of his political career, Sanjay Sinh has been no stranger to headlines. From being a confidant of Sanjay Gandhi in the Congress in the early 1980s to contesting against Rajiv Gandhi a few years later (Janata Dal) and then moving to the BJP to contest against Sonia Gandhi in 1999, Sinh has travelled many paths. After attacking the Congress in many forms and being away for years, he returned to the party in 2003 and went on to win the Sultanpur Lok Sabha seat in 2009. Seen as an asset in Amethi—Rahul Gandhi’s constituency till this election—Sinh said he quit because the party lacked leadership. After 16 years, he said he will now return to the BJP. His wife Ameeta also quit the Congress party with him, where she was an office-bearer. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.When he joins the saffron party, it will be a homecoming of a different kind for Sinh, whose legally wedded wife Garima Singh is already in that party and an MLA from Amethi. Both Sinh and Ameeta faced charges in the 1987 murder case of ace badminton player Syed Modi, who Ameeta was married to. Though the charges were dropped after a few years and Sinh married Ameeta, Garima had challenged the legitimacy of the marriage. Meanwhile in Amethi, though Congress leadership maintained a stoic silence, Sanjay Sinh’s exit from the party is being debated by Congressmen. Top CommentMurderer.. KamalSee All CommentsAdd comment“Sanjay was the party’s go-to man in Amethi. His exit comes at a time when the party is already battling for survival in a Congress fortress. The burden of Rahul’s humiliating defeat has been furthered by this,” said a senior leader in Amethi. A young spokesperson, meanwhile, said: “Sinh could not save his bastion (Sultanpur) and lost to Maneka Gandhi this time. His contribution can be gauged from Rahul’s loss, party’s poor show in local bodies and Vidhan Sabha elections.”

column2: GDA to start slapping fines as roadside parking blocks lanes
column3: GHAZIABAD: The Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) will soon carry out inspections at housing societies and residential buildings that are using parking spaces to run commercial activities, resulting in vehicles meant to be inside the premises being parked on the road. Roadside parking has for years been a major problem in places like Indirapuram - whose administration GDA is in charge of - and leads to traffic jams on even its wide internal roads in the morning and evening rush hours as well as during weekends when traffic flow is higher. In several areas, like the road leading to Kala Patthar, roadside parking has permanently shaved off a lane, restricting traffic to a single file. Senior GDA officials said adequate parking area had been assigned in building plans. "Earlier, every plotted area was allotted a minimum of 112 square metres of stilt parking along with three floors above this. In 2015, the building bylaws were amended after which the lower limit for stilt parking was increased to 150sqm," said Kanchan Verma, vice-chairperson, GDA. "This was to ensure residents get more parking space. But this measure doesn't appear to have been effective, primarily because developers have used the stilt parking space to set up commercial establishments," she added. The inspections will be followed by fines. "After the survey to ascertain the extent of violations, the enforcement wing of GDA will be asked to penalise violators and put an end to the practice," said Verma. The areas which the GDA has identified for the survey include Indirapuram, Vaishali, Rajendra Nagar, Shalimar Garden and parts of Sahibabad. "After a detailed inspection, we found the problem is most prevalent on Kala Patthar road, SRS Cinemas road and Swarna Jayanti Park road," said Verma. NEWS IN BRIEFEXPLORE BRIEFSAmid Covid surge, Centre's 5-step containment strategy for statesIndia witnessing a sharp rise in coronavirus infections, Union health secretary Rajesh Bhushan on Saturday held a meeting with officials from 12 worst-hit states and presented a five-fold containment strategy to bring the situation under control.Over 60 protesters killed in Myanmar on 'day of shame for armed forces'Myanmar's security forces shot and killed at least 64 people - including a young boy - on Saturday, news reports and witnesses said, even as the ruling junta's leader said the military would protect the people and strive for democracy.Last July, the Central Road Research Institute (CRRI), in its comprehensive mobility plan for Indirapuram, had highlighted that encroachment caused by illegal parking inhibits the flow of traffic. Illegal street parking blocks space equivalent to that of 450 cars at any given point in time on Kala Patthar road alone, according to the survey report. Along SRS Cinemas, that number is 287 while on Swarna Jayanti Park road and CISF Road, it is around 128. The CRRI had suggested construction of multi-level parking lots in the area and recommended penalties to be charged from defaulters to deter this problem.
